snippet: Responding to criticism from a German official, Louis Gallois pointed to robust earnings and orders as proof that all countries with a stake in the European aerospace company were being served.
abstract: Departing chief of European Aeronautic Defense and Space Louis Gallois, responding to criticism from a German official, urges European governments to refrain from meddling in company affairs; points to robust 2011 earnings and record jet orders at its Airbus unit as proof that national interests are being served by the group's recent turnaround.
lead_paragraph: Responding to criticism from a German official, Louis Gallois pointed to robust earnings and orders as proof that all countries with a stake in the European aerospace company were being served.

headline.main: Chief of Airbus Parent Warns on Government Meddling
headline.print_headline: Chief of Airbus Parent Warns on Government Meddling

keywords.value: European Aeronautic Defense and Space Co
keywords.name: organizations
